critique: This executive order aims to strengthen historically Black colleges and universities (HBCUs) through federal programs and private sector partnerships. It establishes an advisory commission and outlines specific actions for various government departments to increase HBCU participation in federally sponsored programs. The order emphasizes accountability through annual plans, progress reports, and periodic reviews. It also seeks to improve HBCU financial security and enhance career prospects for their graduates, particularly in science and technology. The focus on supporting HBCUs suggests a commitment to social inclusion and equal opportunity. There is a slight expansion of federal oversight through the establishment of new boards and reporting requirements.
